meanings.definition: To cause (an image) to break up into pixels.
meanings.sent1: When you zoom in too much on the picture, it pixelates and becomes blurry.
meanings.sent2: The video quality deteriorated, and the image pixelates on the screen.
meanings.sent3: I tried to enlarge the photo, but it just pixelates and looks like a digital puzzle.
meanings.sent4: As the signal weakened, the TV screen started to pixelate, resembling a mosaic of colors.
meanings.sent5: The old computer struggled to display the high-resolution image and began to pixelate in patches.

meanings.sent1: The image pixelates when the internet connection is slow.
meanings.sent2: As the video streamed, it started to pixelate due to network congestion.
meanings.sent3: The photo on the website pixelates amusingly when you try to zoom in too much.
meanings.sent4: Her memory of the event began to pixelate, blurring the details over time.
meanings.sent5: The screen pixelates briefly before clearing up when switching to a higher resolution.
